text.content:
Use the filter dropdowns above to drill down to a single cluster / location / namespace / model. Some of these charts (e.g. p50 latency) may not show meaningful values when aggregated over multiple models.

For more information on setting up vLLM in your GKE cluster, see [Serve Gemma open models using GPUs on GKE with vLLM](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/tutorials/serve-gemma-gpu-vllm).

sectionHeader.subtitle: Inspect the rate at which the model server is handling requests and processing tokens.

widget.title: n param distribution (# of output sequences returned)
best_of param distribution (# of output sequences generated)

sectionHeader.subtitle: Inspect the processing time taken for entire requests, as well as per token latencies.
Inspect how frequently the cache is being hit, which can impact performance.
If you have configured speculative decoding within vLLM, use these metrics to evaluate its efficiency.
